description: A stop usually found on theater organs, consisting of wooden bars suspended over resonators (like the orchestral prototype) and struck by an electric or pneumatic mechanism. It often has a reiterating action, played from the same physical stop as the single-stroke Harp.
examplesDescription: Marimba 8' (strike), Marimba 8' (roll), Solo; Kotzschmar Memorial Organ, City Hall, Portland, Maine, USA; Austin 1912.
